events.event_description: Sprague opened the first East Coast retail station offering renewable diesel.
events.citation: Sprague, an energy supplier in the Northeast, opened the first East Coast retail station offering renewable diesel in January 2024.

events.event_description: Sprague opened renewable diesel terminals in the Bronx and upstate New York.
events.citation: It also opened renewable diesel terminals in the Bronx in New York City in June 2023 and in upstate New York in June 2024.

events.event_description: Global Partners began offering renewable diesel at its terminal in East Haven, Connecticut.
events.citation: In August 2024, the energy supplier Global Partners began offering renewable diesel at its terminal in East Haven, Connecticut.

events.event_description: East Coast renewable diesel consumption reached record highs ranging from 5,000 to 7,000 barrels per day.
events.citation: In each of the five most recent months for which we have historical data (May–September), consumption of renewable diesel on the East Coast has been above the previous record high, ranging from 5,000 barrels per day (b/d) to 7,000 b/d.

events.event_description: Neste delivered renewable diesel to the East Coast, averaging 3,000 b/d through September 2024, with imports coming from plants in Singapore, Finland, and the Netherlands.
events.citation: Through September 2024, Neste delivered renewable diesel to the East Coast each month except for April and May, shipping an average of 3,000 b/d during the first nine months of the year.

events.event_description: Section 45Z Clean Fuel Production Credit implementation announced, which will make biofuel imports ineligible for tax credits.
events.citation: These trade dynamics could change in 2025 with implementation of the Section 45Z Clean Fuel Production Credit, a provision in the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 that would make biofuel imports ineligible for tax credits.
